sentence.Network_en: a commutation of the death sentence to life imprisonment
The prisoner obtained a commutation of his sentence from death to life imprisonment.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个囚犯得到减刑,由死刑改判无期徒刑.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'exchange, barter', later 'alteration'): from Latin commutatio(n-), from commutare 'exchange, interchange' (see commute). Sense 1 dates from the late 16th cent

means.word_mean: 2. a warrant substituting a lesser punishment for a greater one
3. (law) the reduction in severity of a punishment imposed by law
4. the act of putting one thing or person in the place of another: "he sent Smith in for Jones but the substitution came too late to help"
